title: Three Main Factors Drove the Strong Performance of Aluminum Prices in January
summary: Aluminum prices rose 6.3% in January 2026, driven by rigid supply constraints, structural demand growth, and macroeconomic factors combined with low inventory levels. The market has experienced a slight recent decline after reaching highs on January 14th, but medium-to-long term outlook remains supported by supply and demand fundamentals.

title: Live Aluminum Prices Today
summary: Aluminum edged higher as intensifying supply risks offset a pause in downstream buying, with physical tightness continuing to support prices. The article provides current pricing analysis and explains aluminum's role as a critical energy metal classified by the U.S. Government in 2022.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum rose to $3,137.95 USD/T on January 21, 2026, up 0.65% from the previous day, with prices up 6.63% over the past month and 19.09% year-over-year. Trading Economics forecasts aluminum to trade at $3,172.03 by end of quarter and $3,298.05 in 12 months.

title: Citigroup Report on Aluminum Price Targets
summary: Citigroup raised its 0-3 month aluminum price target to $3,400 per ton, believing aluminum prices still have further upside potential supported by current market fundamentals.

title: Upstream funding, project expansion and tightening supply are resetting aluminium's market direction
summary: LME aluminium prices trended positively in early January 2026 due to declining exchange stocks and tightening supply. Key developments include NALCO's pilot plant for bauxite residue processing and Alba's record 1.61 million tonnes production in 2025 despite challenges. China's 45 million tonne capacity cap, smelter shutdowns, and US tariffs contribute to a global supply deficit.

title: 2026 Global Outlook for New Alumina Supply
summary: China's alumina capacity is expected to reach 118.92 million mt in 2026 with 8.6 million mt of new capacity, intensifying oversupply. Much of the new capacity in Guangxi will shift local supply from tight to surplus, pressuring prices. Overseas, Indonesia and India will add 1 million mt and 500,000 mt respectively, heightening global competition.

title: SunSirs: Three Main Factors Drove the Strong Performance of Aluminum Prices in January
summary: Aluminum prices in East China rose 6.3% in January 2026 to 23,890 RMB/ton as of January 19, driven by supply constraints. China's 45 million ton capacity limit and rising molten aluminum proportion limit ingot supply, while overseas disruptions like Mozal's shutdown and Century Aluminium reductions create a global supply gap of 290,000 to 840,000 tons.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Consumer Personal and Home Care Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have collaborated to produce the first aerosol can using ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology, which eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum smelting by generating oxygen instead of CO2. The can consists of 50% ELYSIS primary aluminum and 50% post-consumer recycled content, creating one of the lowest-carbon packaging solutions available. This initiative demonstrates cross-industry collaboration to accelerate low-carbon aluminum innovations for personal care and home products.

title: Unilever, Ball and Alcoa unveil “first” carbon-free aluminum aerosol can
summary: Ball Corporation, Unilever, and Alcoa have debuted the first aerosol can made with Elysis carbon-free smelting technology, combining 50% Elysis aluminum and 50% recycled content to eliminate direct GHG emissions from smelting. The innovation targets personal care products like deodorants and cleaning items, supporting decarbonization in aluminum packaging. Elysis, a partnership of Alcoa and Rio Tinto backed by Apple and governments, produces oxygen instead of CO2 during smelting.

title: INX International to Highlight Metal Decorating Expertise and Manufacturing Performance at Latamcan 2026
summary: INX International announced its participation at Latamcan 2026 to showcase metal decorating expertise and manufacturing performance, with implications for sustainable aluminum applications in packaging. The event focuses on innovations in metal processing relevant to aluminum technology. This highlights ongoing advancements in aluminum-related manufacturing sustainability.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel rose to 941.03 USD/T on January 21, 2026, marking a 0.11% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.64%, and are up 36.78% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts indicate it will trade at 956.97 USD/T by quarter-end and 1030.83 USD/T in 12 months.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 22.01.2026
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel prices, indices, and news. It covers Shanghai Futures for rebar across multiple terms and future contracts for regions including Turkey, China, Europe, and North America, with recent data from January 19-20, 2026. The platform includes sections for latest news on rebar, scrap, and iron-steel markets.

title: Iron ore prices fall for the fifth consecutive session
summary: Iron ore futures prices have declined for the fifth consecutive session. The drop is driven by increased shipments from Rio Tinto, the world's largest iron ore producer. This trend impacts steel production costs and market dynamics.

title: Correction to steel scrap HMS 1&2 index, domestic composite, delivered Saudi Arabia
summary: Fastmarkets corrected the MB-STE-0939 steel scrap HMS 1&2 index from 1,361.52 riyals per tonne to 1,360.19 riyals per tonne for delivery in Saudi Arabia. The pricing database has been updated accordingly. This adjustment is part of their scrap price package.

title: AISI: Raw steel production rises 0.2%
summary: US domestic raw steel production reached 1,756,000 short tons for the week ending January 17, up 0.2% from the prior week, with a capability utilization rate of 75.9%. Year-to-date production stands at 4,238,000 short tons, up 2.9% from last year. Production increased in most regions, marking an eight-week high.

title: US raw steel production is up 0.2 percent - week 2, 2026
summary: According to AISI, US raw steel production for the week ending January 17, 2026, was 1.756 million net tons, up 0.2% from the previous week, with capacity utilization at 75.9%. This represents a 3.3% increase from the same week last year. Adjusted year-to-date production through January 17 is 4.238 million net tons, up 2.9% year-over-year.

title: Tenaris resumes production lines at Koppel steel plant, plans to hire 80 workers
summary: Tenaris is restarting heat treatment and finishing lines at its Koppel, Pennsylvania steel plant to increase production of steel pipe for the oil and gas industry, planning to hire 80 workers. The plant, acquired in 2020, had been idled during the Covid-19 pandemic but has seen $150 million in investments. Recent investments include $2 million for resuming these operations.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel Industry
summary: Fujitsu has launched a demonstration experiment selected for METI's FY2025 Industrial Research Project to track environmental value of green steel through the supply chain using blockchain technology. The experiment, running from December 2025 to February 2026, aims to ensure that emissions reduction certificates and environmental data flow securely from upstream to downstream without duplication, while addressing current business practice challenges.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturers are advancing green steel production through innovations including electric arc mini-mills that recycle steel scrap and hydrogen-based processes, reducing reliance on coal. Companies like Hertha Metals and Electra are deploying technologies that achieve significant cost savings and energy efficiency improvements while lowering carbon emissions compared to traditional steelmaking methods.

title: Steel Industry Carbon Emissions: Complete 2025 Guide To Impact
summary: This guide outlines technology deployment milestones for decarbonizing steel production through 2050, including hydrogen-based steel production scaling to 50+ commercial facilities by 2030, AI-driven process optimization, and circular economy innovations. The roadmap emphasizes the integration of renewable energy infrastructure and digital platforms to achieve net-zero steel production by 2040-2050.

title: Copper Loses Momentum After 62% Rally: Flat 2026 Performance Raises Questions
summary: Domestic copper prices in India fell nearly 1% to ₹1,288.90/kg on Tuesday amid mixed global trends, with MCX January contracts at ₹1,292.10, down ₹10. After a 62% rally in 2025, copper shows flat performance in 2026 due to profit booking, though fundamentals remain supportive with support levels at ₹1,230-₹1,250.

title: Copper rose to 5.79 USD/Lbs on January 22, 2026
summary: Copper prices rose to 5.79 USD/Lbs on January 22, 2026, up 0.43% from the previous day, with a 5.23% monthly gain. On January 21, prices fell to 5.80 USD/Lbs amid demand concerns in China, where the Yangshan import premium halved.

title: LME copper prices rose ~0.4% as tight inventories
summary: LME copper prices rose about 0.4% due to tight inventories. Shanghai transaction prices averaged 99,830 yuan/mt, down slightly by 20 yuan/mt from the previous day.

title: Rio Tinto Q4 Production Increases, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Overnight
summary: Rio Tinto reported Q4 2025 attributable copper production of 240,000 mt, up 5% year-over-year and 18% quarter-over-quarter, with full-year 2025 production reaching 883,000 mt, an 11% cumulative increase. LME copper futures opened at $12,915.5/mt and closed at $12,761.5/mt, down 0.27%, with trading volume at 89,000 lots.

title: Rio Tinto Produced More Copper, Slightly Less Iron Ore Last Year
summary: Rio Tinto reported an 11% increase in copper output for 2025, producing 883,000 metric tons and surpassing its guidance forecast of 860,000-875,000 tons, with Q4 copper output at 240,000 tons, up 5% year-over-year. Growth was driven by rising production from the Oyu Tolgoi mine in Mongolia following its underground expansion.

title: More PV Manufacturers Expected to Adopt Copper Metallization in 2026
summary: 2026 is expected to mark the first year of large-scale mass production for high-copper paste solutions in photovoltaic manufacturing, driven by surging silver prices and sustainability concerns. Gigawatt-scale TOPCon customers and Tier-1 cell manufacturers are accelerating adoption of copper metallization to reduce silver consumption while maintaining conversion efficiency.

title: Lundin Mining Announces 2025 Production Results and 2026 Guidance
summary: Lundin Mining forecasts copper production to remain stable at approximately 310,000 to 335,000 tonnes annually in 2026, consistent with 2025 production levels.

title: Nickel Rebounds Sharply as Market Enters Era of Elevated Volatility
summary: Nickel prices rebounded significantly with macro capital influx, breaking through previous oscillating ranges and approaching 150,000 yuan per ton on the Shanghai exchange. The LME 3-month nickel contract was quoted at $17,140 per ton, with refined nickel showing strong performance and significant premiums over ferronickel and nickel sulfate, driving increased production incentives for high-grade nickel.

title: BMI lowers 2026 nickel price view to $15,500/tn from $16,000/tn
summary: Fitch Solutions company BMI revised its 2026 nickel price forecast downward to $15,500 per tonne due to persistent global supply glut expected to widen to around 250 kilotonnes. Despite the surplus, strong demand from China's net-zero and stainless steel sectors is expected to provide price support, with global nickel consumption projected to rise to 7 million tonnes by 2034.

title: Nickel prices hit 15-month high on robust sentiment
summary: LME nickel prices surged to $18,045 per tonne on January 6, marking a 15-month high driven by macroeconomic developments and potential changes to Indonesia's mining plans. Prices climbed 20% in just 12 trading days from December 17, with the rally supported by rising copper prices and geopolitical concerns affecting metal availability.

title: Nickel Prices Ease as Profit-Taking Hits Market
summary: Nickel futures pulled back from nineteen-month highs toward $18,000 per tonne as profit-taking pressured the market. Chinese demand showed signs of softening, contributing to the price correction.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to 17,902 USD/T on January 22, 2026, amid profit-taking, while SHFE nickel futures dropped 1.6%. Supply constraints persist as Indonesia cut its 2026 nickel ore production quotas by 34% to align with processing capacity. Nickel Industries saw a revenue slump in December due to delayed sales but resumed shipments in early January.

title: Strike Zone Mining Podcast for January 22 2026
summary: Ontario fast-tracks Canada Nickel's Crawford Nickel Project under the 'One Project, One Process' framework. The project near Timmins is positioned for batteries and green steel with plans for mining, processing, and downstream facilities. This accelerates development amid growing demand for electrification metals.

title: Vale Indonesia says 2026 mining quota won't be enough to meet demand new
summary: PT Vale Indonesia's 2026 mining production quota is insufficient for smelter demand from new HPAL plants for EV batteries. The company resumed mining after quota approval delays and seeks additional quota. New plants in Pomalaa and Bahodopi require significant limonite nickel ore annually.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for electric vehicles and green energy. The project uses the innovative DNi Process, which recycles over 98% of nitric acid, requires no tailings dams, and produces minimal waste, ensuring sustainability. Once operational, it will be a carbon-negative facility supplying nickel and cobalt to major partners like GM.

title: Greener method recovers critical metals from spent batteries
summary: Researchers at Monash University have developed a breakthrough method using a mild deep eutectic solvent to recover over 95% of high-purity nickel, cobalt, manganese, and lithium from spent lithium-ion batteries, including complex black mass. This sustainable process avoids high temperatures and hazardous chemicals, offering a safer alternative for recycling. It promotes a circular economy for critical metals and reduces environmental impact from battery waste.

title: Digital integration boosts safety, productivity, sustainability at Anglo American Barro Alto mine
summary: A digitization project at Anglo American's Barro Alto mine, which produces nickel, enhances safety, productivity, and sustainability through integrated digital technologies. Posted on January 20, 2026, the initiative demonstrates how digital tools can improve operations in nickel mining. It aligns with broader goals of sustainable mining practices.

title: Nickel and cobalt out, CO2 in at Turnagain
summary: A proposed mine at the Turnagain project could produce nickel and cobalt while permanently sequestering over 200 million tons of atmospheric CO2, innovating carbon capture in mining. This approach replaces traditional outputs with CO2 storage, enhancing sustainability in nickel production. The project represents a novel technology for green mining.

title: The first Energy Release contract in the Aosta Valley is underway: agreement signed between the CVA Group and Cogne Acciai Speciali
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali and CVA Group have signed an Energy Release agreement to install new renewable energy plants in Sicily with over 20 MW capacity and an estimated output of 593,600 MWh, expected to be fully operational by 2026. This marks the first Energy Release agreement in the Aosta Valley and supports the region's green energy transition and European Green Deal goals. The partnership strengthens both companies' roles in decarbonization while providing CAS with enhanced energy performance and CVA with stabilized revenue flows.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: inaugurazione dell'opera "Per aspera ad astra" di Donato Savin
summary: An artwork titled "Per aspera ad astra" by Donato Savin will be inaugurated on January 22, 2026 at Cogne Acciai Speciali's headquarters in Aosta (Via Paravera 16). This event marks a cultural initiative at the company's main facility.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Tenaris posts 2% rise in quarterly net sales
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in net sales for the third quarter, driven by higher sales across its operations. As the world's leading producer of steel pipes for oil and gas industries, Tenaris generates 95.4% of revenue from pipe production with geographic distribution across North America (45.6%), Asia/Pacific/Middle East/Africa (25.5%), Europe (9.6%), and South America (19.3%).

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy
summary: Tenaris launched Italy's first hydrogen-powered trial at a steel plant in collaboration with Snam and Tenova to evaluate hydrogen's performance in steel production. The six-month project at Tenaris's Dalmine mill in Bergamo aims to reduce carbon emissions by 30% by 2030 and establish safety guidelines for using hydrogen in hard-to-abate industrial sectors.

title: Tenaris Acquires isOplus Oil and Gas Division in $10M Deal
summary: Tenaris acquired isOplus's oil and gas division for $10 million, gaining pre-insulated pipeline systems and anti-corrosion coating capabilities rebranded as Tenaris Coating Italy. The acquisition strengthens Tenaris's offshore market offerings and enables anti-corrosion coating application across facilities in Italy, Mexico, Argentina, and Brazil.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: Tenaris showcased its steel solutions for power generation at the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, highlighting over 25 years of partnership with Sofinter Group. The company demonstrated its high-performance tubular solutions, including Thor® 115 steel for extreme conditions, and its Environmental Product Declaration for sustainable power generation applications.
